entry.title: multipaste: Update HTML preview placeholder icon for refreshed UI
entry.content:
This CL updates bitmap items' placeholder image so that it consists of

an icon atop a colored background rather than a canvas source. The new

placeholder also uses Jelly colors and is not offset by a border. This

CL does not polish bitmap items' spacing according to the refresh spec;

that change will come in a later CL, at which point a pixel test will

also be added (see b/286123401).

entry.title: [Messages] Replace ProgressBar with a circular progress drawable
entry.content:
When focus is moved to the primary button and the primary button

is replaced by the progress bar view, the focus is lost and then reset

to the home button of the toolbar.



This CL removes progress bar view and replaces it with a circular

progress drawable as the background of the primary button such that

the focus always stays on the primary button.



See screenrecord: crbug.com/1395202#c19



Bug: 1395202

entry.title: [CDM] Fixing TestSegmentInfoDB to support new format of DB API's.
entry.content:
[CDM] = Caching Default Models.



This change update the test segment info database to support ModelSource.

Doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-dpjL73J-GSwQS-Uxr7qUGYUPJpnGxaidi0BZ8WpKmM/edit#heading=h.e9574c8baaho

This is required for storing default models in DB.



The plan is to :

1. Add model source to database API and migrate callers to call the API

with server model. (doesn't break anything as this is kind of same

flow as before).

2. Implement the logic for database API.

3. Handle the callers logic to support default models.



This ensures that the compilation works. Also different clients will

have different handling for default models at different layers. So

client default models handling could be a part a other set of CLs.



Planned CL:

- Handling changes required for default models in all the callers.



Change-Id: Ib26c36a2de387491b0c6e27abe9bd1c4ef4fa6c2

Bug: b/285424475

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4583354

Commit-Queue: Ritika Gupta

Reviewed-by: Siddhartha S

entry.title: viz: win: Enable viewporter for SkiaOutputDeviceDCompPresenter
entry.content:
Viewporter is a capability that indicates an output device supports

clipping the root surface. Since the root surface on Windows is just a

normal overlay, it already supports this.



Currently, the only viewporter-specific code is letting DirectRenderer

allocate a root surface that is not the same size as the window. This

lets us avoid constantly reallocating the root surface during e.g.

resize.



Change-Id: Ief7bf0c97534b60f9941a0433ece0adc118c45a1

Commit-Queue: Michael Tang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1154165}

entry.title: Validate metadata of incrementally decoded image
entry.content:
With incremental decoding, we start to use image pixel data when an

image is partially decoded. So we should also validate image metadata

against the container metadata when avifDecoderNthImage() returns

AVIF_RESULT_WAITING_ON_IO.

entry.title: [OBC] Implement Domain cookie features
entry.content:
This CL implements two features for domain cookies with regards to

the Origin-Bound Cookies project. Domain cookies are cookies that have

the `Domain` attribute specified. Origin cookies do not specify the

`Domain` attribute.



1) Domain cookies match all source ports

2) Domain cookies may not shadow origin cookies.

2a) This includes a new warning and exclusion reason.



1: Domain cookies are allowed to be accessed by any port and and won't

get WARN_PORT_MISMATCH nor EXCLUDE_PORT_MISMATCH.



2: Shadowing in this context means that two cookies have the same name.

Domain cookies are not allowed to shadow any origin cookies that would

be sent when both kEnableSchemeBoundCookies and kEnablePortBoundCookies

are enabled.



Domain cookies that are considered shadowing will get

WARN_SHADOWING_DOMAIN or EXCLUDE_SHADOWING_DOMAIN depending on the state

of kEnableSchemeBoundCookies.



For example: if scheme binding is enabled, port binding is disabled,

and we have two cookies

`foo=bar`

`foo=bar2; Domain=example.com`



If the origin cookie has a WARN_PORT_MISMATCH then the domain cookie

would not get an EXCLUDE_SHADOWING_DOMAIN because the origin cookie

wouldn't have been sent if both scheme and port binding were enabled.



By design origin cookies are protected from shadowing across the entire

origin they're bound to. This means that origin cookies set to a

different path than the request url's path will still be protected even

though they won't be accessible.



Bug: 1170548

Change-Id: Ide3c443e5ecfb3d8805cb6ec86f890613fe60606

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4583047

Reviewed-by: Brianna Goldstein

entry.title: viz: Lazily create RPDQ mask image shader
entry.content:
This CL makes the mask image shader lazily calculated so its resource is

not resolved until the render pass paint has begun.



Previously, if a RPDQ overlay had a mask image resource,

PrepareRenderPassOverlay would resolve the resource as a part of

calculating the DrawRPDQParams before calling

SkiaOutputSurfaceImpl::BeginPaintRenderPass, which would DCHECK later

when called. We need to calculate the DrawRPDQParams to know the final

size needed for the RPDQ overlay backing, but we don't need to resolve

the resouce image at that point.



This CL helps the case of PrepareRenderPassOverlay so we don't create an

SkPromiseImage if we end up skipping the render pass paing by using a

bypass quad for the RPDQ overlay.



Change-Id: If939aa402c91f1b5eea75ea28bdc1d4388ebd484

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4470257

entry.title: Revert "Fenced frames: Local network access."
entry.content:
This reverts commit c02af164b8b7cee63e3c97901113c386f9100e67.



Reason for revert: The tests introduced in this CL are failing.



Original change's description:

> Fenced frames: Local network access.

>

> Fenced frames are only allowed in secure context. So the tests are

> all in secure contexts.

>

> 1. Subresource fetch:

>

> Fenced frame's IP address space is set to `kPublic` in order to make

> it subject to local network access check.

>

> web_tests/external/wpt/fetch/local-network-access/

> fetch.https.window.js is replicated and replaced iframes with fenced

> frames. All test cases are passing with the same behaviors as iframes.

>

> 2. Document fetch:

>

> Fenced frame's document fetch initiator can only be the parent.

> Fenced frames can only be navigated in two ways:

>

> 1. Directly by their parent, and never by another frame at a distance

> via `window.location` or `window.open`; in this case the `ClientSecurityState` needs to come from the parent.

> 2. By themselves; in this case the `ClientSecurityState` also needs to

> come from its embedder/parent.

>

> The ClientSecurityState of its parent is supplied to the

> NavigationURLLoader.

>

> web_tests/external/wpt/fetch/local-network-access/

> iframe.tentative.https.window.js is replicated and replaced iframes

> with fenced frames. All test cases have the same results as the

> iframe test expectations, except one:

>

> treat-as-public-address to local (same-origin): no preflight

> required

>

> - Iframe: the request is made without preflight. The nested iframe is

> loaded successfully.

>

> - Fenced frame: a preflight is made, and gets blocked. See a. below.

>

> I changed the test expectation for this test only. (PASS for iframe,

> but FAIL for fenced frame)

>

> Here are some noteworthy things we observed for document fetch. The

> following only applies to embedder-initiated navigations (i.e., the

> initial navigation of the frame):

> a. Fenced frame's document fetch's preflight request is always sent

> with `Origin: null`. This applies to embedder-initiated navigations

> (i.e., the initial navigation of the frame). I think this affects the

> outcome of Local Network Access check algorithm.

> https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/fenced_frame/fenced_frame.cc;l=119-126?q=fencedframe::n&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc

>

> A `null` origin implies

> LocalNetworkAccessChecker::is_potentially_trustworthy_same_origin_

> will always be false.

>

> b. For testing purposes, we tried manually overriding the initiator

> origin with a real origin and found that the preflight request still

> failed. This is because the credentials mode of the navigation is

> `'include'`, which prevents `Access-Control-Allow-Origin: '*'` from

> working, which iframes equivalently suffer from: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/web_tests/external/wpt/fetch/local-network-access/iframe.tentative.https.window-expected.txt?q=%22FAIL%20%22%20f:third_party%2Fblink%2Fweb_tests%2Fexternal%2Fwpt%2Ffetch%2Flocal-network-access%2Fiframe.tentative.https.window-expected.txt.

>

> Bug: 1420626

> Change-Id: I74c97369d235e1725c650bfe87f29372992cb56b

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4532557

> Reviewed-by: Titouan Rigoudy

> Reviewed-by: Alex Moshchuk

> Reviewed-by: Weizhong Xia

> Commit-Queue: Xiaochen Zhou

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1154027}

entry.title: [RemoveLegacy] Remove unused `BreakSpaceType`s
entry.content:
This patch changes two `BreakSpaceType` that are no longer

used:

* `kBeforeEverySpace` is the mode for the legacy line breaker.

* `kBeforeSpaceRun` is the mode used by `NGLineBreaker`

initially, but is no longer used when its `pre-wrap` support

was improved.



Also, this patch includes:

* Change the default of `LazyLineBreakIterator` to

`kAfterSpaceRun`.

* Add a constructor that copies settings from another

`LazyLineBreakIterator`.

* Remove a constructor without arguments, that is only used by

tests.

* Update unit tests to use `kAfterSpaceRun`.



This patch should have no behavior changes.

entry.title: [text-wrap-pretty] Apply the algorithm only to clamped lines
entry.content:
Similar to what crrev.com/c/4302514 did for `text-wrap:

balance`, this patch changes the `NGScoreLineBreaker` to apply

only to clamped lines when `line-clamp` is applied.



In doing this, this patch changes `SuspendUntilConsumed` to

`SuspendUntilEndParagraph`. They are the same conditions for

most cases, but when lines are clamped, `NGScoreLineBreaker`

wants to be suspended until all hidden lines are laid out.



This change fixes `text-wrap-balance-line-clamp-001.html` when

`NGScoreLineBreaker` is used for `text-wrap: balance`.

entry.title: [Extensions] Simplify ServiceWorker keepalive counts for API calls
entry.content:
When an extension API is called from an ephemeral context like a

service worker (or in MV2, an event page), we increment the keepalive

count for the ephemeral context. We then decrement that keepalive count

when the API call is complete.



For event page contexts, we handle this entirely in the browser context

in response to the API call coming in. For service workers, we currently

have two separate IPC messages: one for the API call and a second to

increment the keepalive. We similarly have an "ack" in the renderer that

responds to the API call completion and sends the message to decrement

the keepalive.



At the time, this was done because it was simpler than incorporating the

keepalive logic into the API call message (as it is for the event page

case); this was in part due to service worker management previously

running on the IO thread. This is no longer the case, and its simpler

now to simply tie this into the browser receiving the API call.



Do this, and have the browser handle incrementing and decrementing the

keepalive count directly in response to the extension API call. This

has the following advantages:

- Significantly less code overall

- Fewer IPC messsages

- More similar code paths for event pages + service workers

- The service worker keepalive count now uses the (more common)

ProcessManager::[In|De]crementServiceWorkerKeepaliveCount()

methods, which provide more information in debugging and make it

easier to audit callsites.



As part of this, we also add a UUID to ExtensionFunctions. This is

used to track the request in the service worker layer. In the future,

we can use this in lieu of the existing integer request ID.



Bug: 1423190, 1444561

Change-Id: I249a4de1a85b74a125f9321cbaf32fc85b55a3ac

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4518520

entry.title: ipcz: Allow node reconnection
entry.content:
If an application explicitly issues a ConnectNode() call targeting a

broker to which it's already been connected, ipcz will now assume the

application intended to replace the old connection. Prior to this

change the new connection request would effectively be ignored.



Additionally, when a non-broker loses a connection to its primary broker

it also now severs its connections to all other nodes. This resolves a

related issue that affected tests for the above changes.



Fixed: 1449062

entry.title: viz: Use exact size matching for SkiaRenderer render pass backings
entry.content:
We already bucket RenderPassRequirement sizes to multiples of 64 pixels

in DirectRenderer, so we can use exact matching to check if existing

allocations are valid. Without this, it's possible for a render pass

with the same ID to resize smaller without deallocating the wasted

pixels.



This also fixes an issue on Windows w/ DCompPresenter caused by

https://crrev.com/c/4559147, where the root surface would only

reallocate to be larger, but not smaller.



Change-Id: Ib12e6c58e3db0b35cc37a65e00cd8a296c1718cd

entry.title: [A11y] Speculative fix for placeholder elements trying to add children
entry.content:
The crash reports are all logging placeholder elements as trying to add

children but having a return value of false for CanHaveChildren(). A

possible explanation is that CanHaveChildren() returned true earlier

because the placeholder element.ShadowPseudoId() value was not set

for the initial call.



This hopefully fixes the issue by using a more robust API to check for

the placeholder element. Even if it does not fix the crash, it seems

cleaner and less brittle.

entry.title: Remove clang subrevision from the Rust toolchain package version
entry.content:
This allows the Clang package to be updated, when the LLVM version

does not change, without invalidating the Rust toolchain. Since the

Rust package has built its own LLVM, changes in the Clang package

should not need to invalidate it.



If changes to build.py are desired to affect the Rust package, then

the Rust bots should be run to pick it up and generate a new Rust

package anyhow.



This avoids a sharp edge where a Clang fix would cause gclient sync

to be unable to find the Rust toolchain tarball due to the Clang

subrevision mismatch. And thus avoids having to repackage the Rust

toolchain for Clang-only changes.



Bug: 1401042

Change-Id: I05bd844da4dd4509369d7b2723a03505eab5c537

entry.title: Cleanup ContextCreationAttribs
entry.content:
Bunch of attributes are not used anymore:

* buffer_preserved is not read, nothing sets it to not default value

* single_buffer nothing sets it to not default value

* samples/sample_buffers/stencil_size/depth_size are default inited to

-1 and only overridden to 0. Command decoders check if they are > 0,

so that code is never reached.

* gpu::Capabilities::num_stencil_bits is not used.

* red/green/blue_bits are used only on android [1] and alpha_size is

set to only on android.



This CL removes unused attributes and code that sets it in the client.

Immediate affected code from GLES2 decoders is also removed, to make

this compile, but extensive cleanup will be done in follow-up.



Color attributes are not really needed on Android either, but it's not

trivial clean up, so for now put them under BUILDFLAG(IS_ANDROID).



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:gpu/ipc/service/gles2_command_buffer_stub.cc;l=140-144;drc=b8a0323a84f483b25e94b3a24d80fda16c5dd1ae;bpv=0;bpt=1

entry.title: Chrome OnDemand: use SxS IIDs introduced by the Updater
entry.content:
This CL makes Chrome query for the SxS IIDs first, with a fallback to

the legacy IIDs. Without this change, marshaling can load the typelib

from the wrong hive (HKCU instead of HKLM, or vice-versa).



For context, crbug.com/1434887 introduced marshaling and registration

logic to make different (but binary-identical) COM interfaces for user

and system respectively for the Omaha/Updater legacy interfaces.

entry.title: [iOS][Toolbar] Pipe locationBar references through ToolbarCoordinator
entry.content:
Move omnibox and locationBar calls from PrimaryToolbarCoordinator to

ToolbarCoordinator.



- `isOmniboxFirstResponder` and `showingOmniboxPopup` can be called

directly from toolbarCoordinator since it owns the location bar.

- Consequently, in adaptive toolbar, move these method in the protected

section.

- Pipe `transitionToLocationBarFocusedState` through ToolbarCoordinator.

Later CL will move the omniboxFocusOrchestrator to ToolbarCoordinator.



This continues the effort of removing primaryToolbarCoordinator direct

references from BVC.

Later CL will remove other toolbar responsibilities from BVC.

entry.title: [sysroot] Include limits.h in stddef.h
entry.content:
There is a bug in glibc where the inline definition of realpath(...)

changes whether or not limits.h was included before stdlib.h [0], which

causes ODR violations in C++. This patch works around this issue by

including limits.h in stdlib.h, forcing the definition of realpath(...)

to be the same in all translation units.



This bug was discovered while attempting to build Chrome with Clang

modules.

entry.title: [PM] Collect CPU usage estimates in PageTimelineMonitor
entry.content:
At each UKM snapshot calculates the CPU usage for a page by taking the

percentage of CPU usage since the last snapshot for each process,

dividing it among the frames and workers for that process, and then

summing the estimate of each frame and worker in the page.



Also fixes Windows ProcessMetrics::GetPreciseCumulativeCPUUsage() to

fall back to GetCumulativeCPUUsage() if TSCTicksPerSecond isn't

initialized.



R=pmonette

entry.title: Fenced frames: Local network access.
entry.content:
Fenced frames are only allowed in secure context. So the tests are

all in secure contexts.



1. Subresource fetch:



Fenced frame's IP address space is set to `kPublic` in order to make

it subject to local network access check.



web_tests/external/wpt/fetch/local-network-access/

fetch.https.window.js is replicated and replaced iframes with fenced

frames. All test cases are passing with the same behaviors as iframes.



2. Document fetch:



Fenced frame's document fetch initiator can only be the parent.

Fenced frames can only be navigated in two ways:



1. Directly by their parent, and never by another frame at a distance

via `window.location` or `window.open`; in this case the `ClientSecurityState` needs to come from the parent.

2. By themselves; in this case the `ClientSecurityState` also needs to

come from its embedder/parent.



The ClientSecurityState of its parent is supplied to the

NavigationURLLoader.



web_tests/external/wpt/fetch/local-network-access/

iframe.tentative.https.window.js is replicated and replaced iframes

with fenced frames. All test cases have the same results as the

iframe test expectations, except one:



treat-as-public-address to local (same-origin): no preflight

required



- Iframe: the request is made without preflight. The nested iframe is

loaded successfully.



- Fenced frame: a preflight is made, and gets blocked. See a. below.



I changed the test expectation for this test only. (PASS for iframe,

but FAIL for fenced frame)



Here are some noteworthy things we observed for document fetch. The

following only applies to embedder-initiated navigations (i.e., the

initial navigation of the frame):

a. Fenced frame's document fetch's preflight request is always sent

with `Origin: null`. This applies to embedder-initiated navigations

(i.e., the initial navigation of the frame). I think this affects the

outcome of Local Network Access check algorithm.

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/fenced_frame/fenced_frame.cc;l=119-126?q=fencedframe::n&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc



A `null` origin implies

LocalNetworkAccessChecker::is_potentially_trustworthy_same_origin_

will always be false.



b. For testing purposes, we tried manually overriding the initiator

origin with a real origin and found that the preflight request still

failed. This is because the credentials mode of the navigation is

`'include'`, which prevents `Access-Control-Allow-Origin: '*'` from

working, which iframes equivalently suffer from: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/web_tests/external/wpt/fetch/local-network-access/iframe.tentative.https.window-expected.txt?q=%22FAIL%20%22%20f:third_party%2Fblink%2Fweb_tests%2Fexternal%2Fwpt%2Ffetch%2Flocal-network-access%2Fiframe.tentative.https.window-expected.txt.



Bug: 1420626

Change-Id: I74c97369d235e1725c650bfe87f29372992cb56b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4532557

Reviewed-by: Titouan Rigoudy

entry.title: Using `qr_code` Rust crate if `kRustyQrCodeGeneratorFeature` is enabled.
entry.content:
After this CL QR code generation will use the `qr_code` Rust crate if

*all* of the following conditions are true:



* The target platform has Rust toolchain

* `enable_rust_base_conversions` GN arg is true

* The newly added `enable_rust_qr` GN arg is true (it is false by

default)

* The newly added `kRustyQrCodeGeneratorFeature` is enabled (it is

disabled by default)





Unit tests coverage

-------------------



The CL has parametrized 3 tests in qr_code_generator_unittest.cc so that

they run once against the old / first-party / C++ implementation and

once against the new / third-party / Rust implementation.



The unit tests above have been run on the bots via `Cq-Include-Trybots`

directives. Eventually CQ coverage will be provided after enabling the

RustyQrCodeGenerator feature by default.





Image-level test coverage

-------------------------



The CL does *not* parameterize qrcode_generator_service_pixeltest.cc,

because (sadly) the output differs across C++ and Rust:



* Rust uses QR code version 5 with medium (M) error correction. (Rust

picks the minimal QR version where the input will fit and always

uses M error correction).

* C++ uses QR code version 5 with low (L) error correction (C++ only

supports the following 5 combinations of QR code versions and error

correction levels: 2-L, 5-M, 7-M, 9-M, 12-M).



Test coverage for the end-to-end functionality is provided by:



* Manual smoke tests:

* Building Chrome with `enable_rust` and `enable_rust_qr` GN args

set to true, and with `--enable-features=RustyQrCodeGenerator`

* Using the omnibox to generate a QR code for https://example.com

* Using a stable version of Chrome/Android to scan and verify the QR

code

* Eventually CQ coverage will be provided after enabling the

RustyQrCodeGenerator feature by default.



Bug: 1431991

entry.title: Invalidate weak pointers in OnJavascriptDisallowed
entry.content:
When JavaScript is disallowed it is necessary to invalidate the

associated weak factory pointers because otherwise JavaScript will be

used when it is not available. This was leading to test failures on

some Windows 11 machines, perhaps due to ARM64 hardware or timing

differences.



Prior to this change we would reliably get failures on our ARM64

swarming bots. With this fix I have had zero failures on seven runs.

the change right away once the change is made. The change is saved

to file once the check/confirm button is pressed.

entry.title: Privacy Guide: Correctly handle BottomSheetController
entry.content:
When the Activity is created normally the lifecycle calls are:

1. SettingsActivity#onCreate (initBottomSheet)

2. SettingsActivity#onAttachFragment (setBottomSheetController)

...



When the activity is recreated the order of the first 2 calls above is

not guaranteed, thus the BottomSheetController can be set even though

it is not initiated (it is null).



Fix:

- Call setBottomSheetController in onAttachedToWindow. The controller

is guaranteed to be initialized at this point.

- Wrap the BottomSheetController in a Provider so that it is guaranteed

to be set in onResume for SafeBrowsingFragment.





Bug: 1451231, 1238896
